meanings.definition: Bepat (verb): to move quickly or suddenly in a particular direction
meanings.sent1: She bepat across the room to catch the falling vase.
meanings.sent2: The cat bepat out of the way when the door slammed.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel bepat up the tree to escape the chasing dog.
meanings.sent4: Time seemed to bepat forward as the deadline approached.
meanings.sent5: The ball bepat off the wall with a loud thud.

meanings.definition: Bepat (adjective): showing sudden or quick movement
meanings.sent1: His bepat reaction saved him from the oncoming car.
meanings.sent2: The bepat rabbit darted into its burrow at the slightest noise.
meanings.sent3: The bepat wind tousled her hair as she ran to catch the bus.
meanings.sent4: The bepat river rushed over the rocks with a soothing sound.
meanings.sent5: The bepat clouds raced across the sky, signaling an approaching storm.

meanings.definition: Bepat (noun): a sudden or quick movement
meanings.sent1: The sudden bepat of the deer startled the hikers.
meanings.sent2: His bepat was so swift that no one could follow his trail.
meanings.sent3: The bepat of the falling book made everyone in the library turn around.
meanings.sent4: The bepat of the dancer's feet echoed through the hall.
meanings.sent5: The bepat of the drum added excitement to the music performance.
